messages.subject: Re: Youkoso!
messages.msgSnippet: Yeah, but you re the owner and you ve just moved three of us to moderator status.  Masayoshi really is a perfect Hijikata (in terms of ability, not mood).
messages.messageBody:
Yeah, but you're the owner and you've just moved three of us to
moderator status. Masayoshi really is a perfect Hijikata (in terms
of ability, not mood). That leaves MissB & me as Okita and Nagakura,
ne?

pachi (aka Shinpachi aka phil... developing Saitou Disorder here with
name changes)

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, Barbara Sheridan <bsher213@b...> wrote:
> Masayoshi was first to post therefore Kondou then I get to be
Hijikata
> or even Yamanami in my email Miss B and myself both
> posted at 10:21
>
>
> --
> Barbara Sheridan
> http://www.barbarasheridan.net

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Youkoso!
messages.msgSnippet: You really are greedy aren t you?? Look, just accept that I m conceding the man of my obsessions to you with grace and dignity and forget the pay.  :-)  We ve
messages.messageBody:
You really are greedy aren't you?? Look, just accept that I'm conceding the man of my obsessions to you with grace and dignity and forget the pay. :-) We've got to stop this before we drive everyone away (or fill up the files).
phil

Warg3791@... wrote:
In a message dated 3/17/2004 11:36:58 AM Eastern Standard Time,
spiritus_saitou@... writes:
Are you considering Masayoshi is Hijikata? That fits well. :-)
phil
Yeah. I agree there. I still want to know about this me being Okita and Saito
thing though! Does that mean I get double pay?

-MissBehavin

Warg3791@... wrote:
In a message dated 3/17/2004 11:22:20 AM Eastern Standard Time,
spiritus_saitou@... writes:
If MissB's taking the second post then that means I'm taking
the "third," which means I get the captain of the *third* squad ---
SAITOU!!

phil (sticking her tongue out at MissB, although it looks like I've
been superceded by the owner... wouldn't that make Barb Kondou or
Matsudaira?)
Actually, I think that if I'm the second post and Barb is Kondou, then I'm
Okita and you're Shinpachi....
So I'm both Okita and Saito?! O.o" I have my work cut out for me!!!

-MissBehavin

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Youkoso!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/17/2004 10:18:04 AM Eastern Standard Time, patriot014@.*** writes: Youkoso, minna-sama! On behalf of everyone on the Miburo list, I
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/17/2004 10:18:04 AM Eastern Standard Time,
patriot014@... writes:
Youkoso, minna-sama! On behalf of everyone on the Miburo list, I would
like to welcome all Miburo veterans and new members to SHQ! Though
"our" guys may have departed from this world in a blaze of glory, they
have been condemned to relative ignominy. It would seem, however, that
the Japanese public is rediscovering their value, and we who are
outside of Japan have learned of their reknown. This group will, among
other things, help to further the knowledge of the Shinsengumi in the
world. Although, as the description indicated, we also enjoy simply
being Shinsengumi otaku...^_^

--Shimazu Masayoshi

P.S. Irony of ironies, huh? A Shimazu in a Shinsengumi group...but
we'll leave that for the historical details that'll be posted soon.
I just wanted to add Amen to that! Well, that and to be the second post!

-MissBehavin


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Youkoso!
messages.msgSnippet: Youkoso, minna-sama! On behalf of everyone on the Miburo list, I would like to welcome all Miburo veterans and new members to SHQ! Though our guys may have
messages.messageBody:
Youkoso, minna-sama! On behalf of everyone on the Miburo list, I would
like to welcome all Miburo veterans and new members to SHQ! Though
"our" guys may have departed from this world in a blaze of glory, they
have been condemned to relative ignominy. It would seem, however, that
the Japanese public is rediscovering their value, and we who are
outside of Japan have learned of their reknown. This group will, among
other things, help to further the knowledge of the Shinsengumi in the
world. Although, as the description indicated, we also enjoy simply
being Shinsengumi otaku...^_^

--Shimazu Masayoshi

P.S. Irony of ironies, huh? A Shimazu in a Shinsengumi group...but
we'll leave that for the historical details that'll be posted soon.
